description: 7.92x33mm 'Kurz' ammunition with 34.3 gr copper head, iron core bullets and steel jacket.  Called 'intermediate rifle cartridge', it was designed to be a middle point between the 7.92x54mm Mauser and the 9mm Parabellum ammo.  Also known as 'Pistolen-Munition M43'

7.92x33mm 'Kurz' ammunition with 124 gr copper head, lead core FMJ bullets, brass jacket.  Called 'intermediate rifle cartridge', it was designed to be a middle point between the 7.92x54mm Mauser and the 9mm Parabellum ammo.  This one was produced in relatively recent times, by Prvi Partizan, Serbia.

Reloaded 7.92x33mm 'Kurz' case, with a 52 gr steel core FMJ bullet replacing the ancient iron core version.  This increases the penetration and slightly reduces the weight, at the cost of slightly reduced damage.
//: This should not exist in reality. It's just a 792x33_kurz but has the copper-iron bullet replaced for copper-steel custom, because I assume that when you reload these you'd be using steel instead of iron
Again, this is just a 792x33_kurz but has the copper-iron bullet replaced for copper-steel custom, reloaded with black powder
